title: [SETUP-BUG] ERR_CONTENT_LENGTH_MISMATCH when accessing UI over GCP IAP Tunnel
body: Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for information on what types of issues we address. **Please fill in this installation issue template to ensure a timely and thorough response.** ### System information - **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Debian GNU/Linux 10 - [a GCP Deep Learning VM](https://cloud.google.com/deep-learning-vm) - **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: `pip install mlflow` - **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: `mlflow, version 1.11.0` - **Python version**: Python 3.7.8 - **Exact command to reproduce**: N/A ### Describe the problem Provide the exact sequence of commands / steps that you executed before running into the problem. Start the mlflow server on the remote VM like so:- ``` pwigg@mlflow:~$ mlflow server --host 0.0.0.0 [2020-11-11 19:30:02 +0000] [10327] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 20.0.4 [2020-11-11 19:30:02 +0000] [10327] [INFO] Listening at: http://0.0.0.0:5000 (10327) [2020-11-11 19:30:02 +0000] [10327] [INFO] Using worker: sync [2020-11-11 19:30:02 +0000] [10330] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 10330 [2020-11-11 19:30:02 +0000] [10332] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 10332 [2020-11-11 19:30:02 +0000] [10333] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 10333 [2020-11-11 19:30:02 +0000] [10334] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 10334 ``` I am using the `host` option because I want to connect to the UI using an [GCP IAP tunnel](https://cloud.google.com/iap/docs/using-tcp-forwarding) from my local machine. I start an IAP tunnel like so:- ```gcloud compute start-iap-tunnel mlflow 5000 --local-host-port=localhost:5000 --zone=europe-west3-a --project my-gcp-project``` I can now browse to the UI on http://localhost:5000 from my local machine. The problem is that various of the static assets don't load and fail with ERR_CONTENT_LENGTH_MISMATCH. I'm not sure if it's the IAP tunnel here that's causing the issue? It seems strange that no-one else seems to have encountered this and I guess the combination of a GCP IAP tunnel and mlflow is fairly rare. I have discovered that moving from the 'sync' worker to the 'gevent' worker fixes it. The gunicorn [docs](https://docs.gunicorn.org/en/stable/design.html#choosing-a-worker-type) state that, "[..] we require a buffering proxy in front of a default configuration Gunicorn" which obviously I don't have in this scenario. Switching to the `gevent` type of worker by adding `--gunicorn-opts "-k gevent"` does the trick. I'm logging this a) in case it helps anyone else (I spent ages troubleshooting this) but also I'm wondering why `sync` is the default worker type? Are there any drawbacks to using `gevent` that I might encounter?
